subject: Re: [junit] running test methods in order
msgSnippet: Hello, ... you can t assume a particular run order for test methods ... you can do the tests in two ways: 1. put the testInsert-method-body and the
messageBody:
Hello,
junit@yahoogroups.com schrieb am 29.01.03 14:10:45:
>
> Hi,
>
> I need to test a simple insertion of a tuple into a data base table.
>
> First I set the table empty, then I test that an specific tuple is
> correctly inserted.
> Then, I try to insert the same tuple again, which would result in an
> exception, since its primary key is duplicated.
>
> Those tow tests I did it in two different testXXX() methods in the
> TestCase: testInsert() and testDuplicated()
>
> The thing is that JUnit runs first the testDuplicated() method and
> then the testInsert(), so the two tests fails!
>
> How can I assure myself that the two test methods run in a particular
> order?
you can't assume a particular run order for test methods

>
> Is this a good testing practice?
you can do the tests in two ways:

1. put the testInsert-method-body and the testDuplicated-body in
one testMethod and run it in your order

2. use the setUp()- and tearDown()-methods. The setUp-Method
is called before a testXXX-Method is called, here you can initialize your
database. the tearDown-Method is called after every testXXX-Method
so here you can clean the database.

hope it helps
-- Georg

> Thanks in advance,
> Gabriel
>
